lead_paragraph: Amazon, Google, IBM and Microsoft are using high salaries and games pitting humans against computers to try to claim the standard on which all companies will build their A.I. technology.

byline.contributor: John Markoff reported from San Francisco and Steve Lohr from New York.
byline.original: By JOHN MARKOFF and STEVE LOHR

headline.print_headline: The Race to Control Artificial Intelligence, and Tech’s Future
headline.main: The Race Is On to Control Artificial Intelligence, and Tech’s Future

snippet: Amazon, Google, IBM and Microsoft are using high salaries and games pitting humans against computers to try to claim the standard on which all companies will build their A.I. technology.
abstract: Numerous big tech companies, like Amazon, Google, IBM and Microsoft, are competing to be main provider of artificial intelligence and have begun circling start-ups as part of 'platform war' over AI software; company that dominates long-promised technology is likely to steer tech industry for years.
